core_meaning: 激发、鼓舞、给予灵感或动力
frequency: 常用词汇，出现在演讲、艺术、文学和日常表达中

history.origin: 来自拉丁语 inspirare，意为 '吹气进入' (in- 进入 + spirare 呼吸)，最初指赋予生命或灵魂。
history.story: 中世纪时，inspire 常用于宗教语境，表示 '神的启示'。后来逐渐引申为 '给予动力或灵感'，应用于文学、艺术、科学和生活。

references.author: Walt Whitman
references.content: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.

references.title: Dead Poets Society
references.note: 影片中老师用诗歌启发学生思考人生，极好地诠释了 inspire 的意义

examples.en: Her speech inspired the team to work harder.
examples.cn: 她的演讲激励了团队更加努力工作。

modern_usage.meaning: 给予艺术或创作的灵感

examples.en: The mountain view inspired him to paint.

modern_usage.meaning: 产生积极的情绪或信念

examples.en: The story inspired hope in millions of readers.
examples.cn: 这个故事在数百万读者心中激发了希望。

quotes: Steve Jobs: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
Walt Whitman: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
daily_usage: 演讲: The leader inspired confidence among the people.
教育: Teachers should inspire curiosity in students.

key_points: 核心含义：吹入生命 → 激发灵感、动力
与艺术、文学、领导力高度相关

animations: 单词卡片翻转 → 背面展示词根
